result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Seeger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With huber for work, school, treatment if meets jail criteria.  Defendant has 45 days to report to jail.  Can be transferred to Wood County Jail.
Effective 11/10/15; with credit for administrative suspension
IID to be installed immediately.  Time will not begin until defendant obtains valid license.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

COURT ORDERS: Pay $1375 fine, inclusive to court cost, NOT include DNA sample and surcharge because of date when offense occurred. CONDITIONS: Serve 5 days MCJ, with huber for work, school, treatment if meets jail criteria. Has 45 days to report to jail. Complete AODA assessment, with follow through. Zero days credit given. Conviction date of 11/10/15 to be entered onto conviction status of driver's license revocation.
